credits.title: Project Story
credits.storyP1: My Volley was developed with passion by Antonin Marcon, an independent developer based in South-West France. The app was initially created for a very personal need: helping his own volleyball team analyze their matches and improve (hence the project name!).
credits.storyP2: Today, the tool is open to all sports enthusiasts ‚Äî volleyball, basketball, tennis and padel ‚Äî who want to track and analyze their performance.
credits.supportDesc: My Volley is free and will remain so. If you enjoy the app, you can support its development with a small coffee!

help.title: Help center
help.scoringP1: Tap "+" below the scoring team's score, choose the action (attack, ace, opponent fault‚Ä¶), then tap on the court to place the point. Then select the relevant player.
help.scoringP2: The score updates automatically. In Tennis and Padel, the 15-30-40-Game scoring is handled automatically, including deuce and tiebreak.
help.heatmapP1: In the Statistics tab, the heatmap shows the impact zones for each team. Hot zones (red) indicate where the most points were scored.
help.heatmapP2: Filter by set or action type for more detailed analysis. Export the heatmap as PNG for your training reports.
help.teamP1: Add your players with their number and name in the Roster. They are saved automatically and reusable for future matches.
help.teamP2: Individual statistics (points scored, faults) are available in the Stats tab.
help.volleyballScored: Points Won: Attack, Ace, Block, Tip, Second touch
help.volleyballFaults: Opponent faults: Out, Net, Missed serve, Block Out
help.volleyballNote: The set ends manually with "End Set". Sides swap automatically.
help.basketballFaults: Negative actions: Missed shot, Turnover, Foul committed
help.basketballNote: The zone beyond the arc is reserved for 3-pointers. End each quarter with "End QT".
help.tennisScored: Winners: Ace, Forehand/Backhand winner, Volley, Smash
help.tennisFaults: Opponent faults: Double fault, Long/Wide out, Net
help.tennisNote: Automatic scoring: 0 ‚Üí 15 ‚Üí 30 ‚Üí 40 ‚Üí Game. Deuce at 40-40, then Advantage. Tiebreak at 6-6.
help.padelScored: Winners: V√≠bora, Bandeja, Smash, Bajada, Par 3
help.padelFaults: Opponent faults: Double fault, Grid, Glass, Out
help.padelNote: Same scoring as tennis with configurable punto de oro option.
help.exportDesc: Export your stats as PNG (screenshot), detailed Excel (XLSX) set by set, or share the match via a unique read-only link.

matchPage.helpBasketP1: 1. Tap "+" below the score of the relevant team.
matchPage.helpBasketP2: 2. Choose the tab: Baskets (1pt Free throw, 2pts Inside, 3pts Outside) or Negative Actions (Missed shot, Turnover, Foul committed).
matchPage.helpBasketP3: 3. Place on the court: for 3-pointers, only the zone beyond the arc is clickable. Then select the player.
matchPage.helpBasketP4: 4. Quarters: "End QT" ends the current period.
matchPage.helpBasketP5: 5. Statistics: Stats tab to see baskets and fouls per player + shot heatmap.
matchPage.helpTennisP1: 1. Tap "+" below the relevant team name.
matchPage.helpTennisP2_tennis: 2. Choose the tab: Winners (Ace, Forehand/Backhand winner, Volley, Smash) or Opponent Faults (Double fault, Long/Wide out, Net).
matchPage.helpTennisP2_padel: 2. Choose the tab: Winners (V√≠bora, Bandeja, Smash, Bajada, Par 3) or Opponent Faults (Double fault, Grid, Glass, Out).
matchPage.helpTennisP3: 3. Place on the court the shot zone, then select the player.
matchPage.helpTennisP4: 4. Automatic scoring: 0 ‚Üí 15 ‚Üí 30 ‚Üí 40 ‚Üí Game. At 40-40: Deuce then Advantage. The set ends automatically (6 games with 2 gap, tiebreak at 6-6).
matchPage.helpTennisP4_padel: 4. Automatic scoring: 0 ‚Üí 15 ‚Üí 30 ‚Üí 40 ‚Üí Game. At 40-40: Deuce then Advantage (or punto de oro if configured). The set ends automatically (6 games with 2 gap, tiebreak at 6-6).
matchPage.helpTennisP5: 5. Statistics: Stats tab for the heatmap, per-player stats and match analysis.
matchPage.helpVolleyP1: 1. Tap "+" below the score of the relevant team. An animated arrow indicates the selected team.
matchPage.helpVolleyP2: 2. Choose the tab: Points Won (Attack, Ace, Block, Tip, Second touch) or Opponent Faults (Out, Net, Missed serve, Block Out).
matchPage.helpVolleyP3: 3. Click the action then place it on the court (allowed zone lights up) and select the player.
matchPage.helpVolleyP4: 4. Manage sets: "End Set" finishes and swaps sides. The winner üèÜ = most sets won.
matchPage.helpVolleyP5: 5. Statistics: Stats tab to see points ‚ö° and faults ‚ùå per player (expandable) + heatmap.
matchPage.helpVolleyP6: 6. Export & Share: PNG stats, court per set, Excel, or share the score via WhatsApp / Telegram / X.
